result.execSummary:
The defendant Mohammed HEDDAOUI was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution to Buffalo Wild Wings and set up a payment plan and budget with his agent.   $500.00 cash bail has already been applied to restitution.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

timeConds.notes: imposed and stayed, to be imposed upon the discretion of the agent.
Perform one hundred (100) hours of community service work within the first year of probation.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail. The matter is continued for initial appearance on 07-25-2016 at 2:30 p.m., Br. 1.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Warrant returned with service of officer thereon.
